website_summaries.verdict: The 27-inch Apple Thunderbolt Display delivers solid picture and audio quality in a stylish aluminum cabinet, but it doesn't come cheap.

customer_reviews.title: Expensive - but a truly fantastic display
customer_reviews.text: I bought a returned product from Amazon warehouse. It is perfect. I use this as a 2nd monitor with an iMac 5k Retina (I have it configured to display video output from Adobe PremiereProCC). It works really well and using the Thunderbolt connection there is no apparent audio or video latency. The 5k iMac has no problem outputting a different resolution this 2nd monitor (without reducing resolution of the iMac 5k display) - so the iMac runs both displays at the native resolution. I am really pleased I chose this as my video output monitor rather than an HDMI TV.
customer_reviews.author: Shrivy

customer_reviews.title: Gorgeous screen, not worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: Admittedly the Thunderbolt monitor is stunning to look at, both in terms of design and screen quality. That said, it's completely inextensible as it has no ports at the back, just the mini-DisplayPort cable and the laptop charger cable (old version with an adaptor for 2012-2016 models). You can buy good monitors for a quarter of the price! Will be selling mine at a year and a half just to free up some space and make back some of the cost.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: High Quality
customer_reviews.text: A few teething problems at first but once overcome, like all Apple products, a brilliant piece of kit. Bought for my daughter to edit photographs for her photography degree. A good saving compared to the Apple site! Advice re. teething problems above ... put laptop to sleep before disconnecting from, and connecting to, the screen. This ensures the screen will wake when reconnecting and waking the laptop. Sometimes it would not wake otherwise, and there is no on/off switch. This seems to have solved the issue and no further problems.
customer_reviews.author: C. D. Saunders

customer_reviews.title: Fab monitor, but overpriced
customer_reviews.text: This is a great monitor - the design and quality are what I've come to expect from Apple (although I do miss the option of booting up the computer via the screen, as was possible on the old Apple Cinema Display). The colours and sharpness on the screen are incredible, although the glossy surface does take a bit of getting used to. The built-in camera and microphone are great for Skype. But is it worth that much money? Hmmm - seems mad that it cost nearly twice the price of the actual computer!
customer_reviews.author: C. Watson-brown

customer_reviews.title: It really is worth the money
customer_reviews.text: What a fantastic screen - with Thunderbolt and power connections to my MacBook Air plus the ports on the back it becomes a sort of docking station. I was thinking of buying a Mac with a larger screen as working on the small screen on the Air was very tight but now I have everything I need - connections to all my peripherals and a lots of screen real estate when working but still have the incredible portability of the Air.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Another good workhorse and good looking too.
customer_reviews.text: This is a nicely designed screen as you would expect. It does everything you need and it is a good size. The only thing I hadn't considered was the glass screen. It is fine for most uses but the reflections can be a little bit of a problem when editing photographs in Photoshop.
customer_reviews.author: Mr Robert K Wilson

customer_reviews.title: The monitor is a dream, although an expensive one ...
customer_reviews.text: The monitor is a dream, although an expensive one, but as a companion to a MacBook I can't see how it can be bettered. It serves not only as the most elegant docking station but also turns your sleeping laptop instantly into a desktop computer with a touch of the keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: Julian Harper

customer_reviews.title: Expensive!!! but indeed a gorgeous display
customer_reviews.text: You get what you paid for... super solid well built with a beautiful screen!! The thunderbolt connection is by far superior to what came before from Apple.
customer_reviews.author: alfaron

customer_reviews.title: Perfect monitor
customer_reviews.text: Was a bit reluctant at first but there is not a mark on this monitor and it is perfect. Thank you
customer_reviews.author: TheHealthyOption

customer_reviews.title: Expensive but worth the money
customer_reviews.text: I hesitated about buying this display screen but it has definitely made it easier for me to work. I like being able to have two applications open at once and being able to easily look from one to the other.
customer_reviews.author: SALLY PERCY

customer_reviews.title: Thunderbolt Display
customer_reviews.text: After weighing up the pro's and con's of buying a dedicated Thunderbolt Display against another manufacturer i am glad I went for the Thunderbolt. It is expensive but set up couldn't have been easier, it's more than a second monitor it's an extension to the mac itself capable of running completely autonomous programmes and really boosted my productivity.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Nelson

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Product
customer_reviews.text: Changed my life. High quality display. Big working space for multiple windows. Super sound. Absolutely gorgeous looking. All delivered promptly and safely by Amazon and supported by Apple. My Macbook Pro loves "docking" with it and the iPad and iPhone connections are simple and uncomplicated. Doesn't get any better.
customer_reviews.author: Gordon Moultrie

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Picture Quality, Fantastic Design
customer_reviews.text: The thunderbolt display looks amazing and has brilliant colours and screen sharpness is stunning it looks really pretty aswell and performs very well the build quality is very solid as well and the sound quality is also just right buy this and you will not be disappointed i brought an iMac and the thunderbolt display is much better you will not be dissappointed
customer_reviews.author: Mr. L. Marshall

customer_reviews.title: Superb monitor plus
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product. It does its job supremely well and is very straightforward. The only problem is its much too expensive, hence 4 stars instead of 5.
customer_reviews.author: D. J. B. Herrera

customer_reviews.title: Expensive but well worth it
customer_reviews.text: Works perfectly with MacBook Pro and looks stunning, taking up relatively little space. BUT....expensive for what is essentially a monitor.
customer_reviews.author: KhalDrogo

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Screen, now even better...
customer_reviews.text: Had this screen for about 18 months now - connected to MacBook Air by the included Thunderbolt lead. Picture is simply wonderful, vibrant, clear images. Using my Macbook Air in clamshell mode has been difficult at times - resolved with several time consuming re-boots - but now with the latest OSX / Thunderbolt software update it all works as it should - highly recommended. Pity a further Thunderbolt lead to connect a HD id not included!
customer_reviews.author: Sandford

customer_reviews.title: Brill!
customer_reviews.text: So far, I have only good things to say about this display! I can't claim to be really that alert regards what possible faults there might be, but I haven't found any. It's all good as far as I'm concerned.
customer_reviews.author: T E Williams

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic screens. I have used these for the past ...
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic screens. I have used these for the past 2 month attached to my Apple Mac Pro and they are great
customer_reviews.author: Alexander

customer_reviews.title: Thunderbolt Displays Rock
customer_reviews.text: We have a few of these, wow Every time you use them your realise how good they are. When its not connected to the mac everything seems somewhat lacking. Surprisingly awesome sound quality too. Hurts the wallet!
customer_reviews.author: CR

customer_reviews.title: Having used a 13inch MacBook for some time was considering ...
customer_reviews.text: Having used a 13inch MacBook for some time was considering getting a larger display and didn't realise that Apple did this. Yes, it is very expensive but as with all Apple products, the build quality is superb and it 'does what it says on the tin'. Up & running in a couple of minutes. Just plug it in and it works! The ability to have more than one screen visible at a time makes working much easier and efficient. If you're thinking about buying one, don't delay, get it ordered!
customer_reviews.author: Mr Patrick Reeve

customer_reviews.title: 100% excellent. Great Prime delivery as usual
customer_reviews.text: 100% excellent. Great Prime delivery as usual. Apple products well what can you say - fantastic and married up with Mac mini. Great bit of kit.
customer_reviews.author: Oumbagirl

customer_reviews.title: Apple 27 inch Thunderbolt Display
customer_reviews.text: What can I say? After squinting at a 13.3 inch Macbook Pro for what seems an eternity, looking at this display is just a wonderful experience! I can see every intricate detail - it's just superb! Expensive - yes - but worth every penny!
customer_reviews.author: Anita

customer_reviews.title: Great basically. But few dust that under glass penal ...
customer_reviews.text: Great basically. But few dust that under glass penal is bothering me. I need to buy glass pullers to get them away.
customer_reviews.author: Ning Ren

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Such a good display. I wouldn't hesitate to buy it again!
customer_reviews.author: ByDesign

customer_reviews.title: It's Apple...what can you say
customer_reviews.text: What can I say about this monitor that already hasn't been said.......nothing really. It's Apple which means quality. I've used with my rMacBook Pro and now with a MacMini........No fiddling with settings just connect via the Thunderbolt cable and switch on.
customer_reviews.author: DaveH48

customer_reviews.title: Thunderbolt display
customer_reviews.text: Had the display monitor for a week very pleased with the unit and the great service
customer_reviews.author: ron cuthbert

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful display. A Dell display of equivalent resolution and spec was around £600 without the built-in charger/power supply, speakers, thunderbolt ports, USB hub, making this a no brainer. Looks every bit as good as the Retina display on my MacBook Pro.
customer_reviews.author: J. J. Warwick

customer_reviews.title: Thunderbolt with Macbook
customer_reviews.text: Great screen and audio, to much light reflection when background is bright. Set up with MacBook, so had to move position.
customer_reviews.author: J. Pichler

customer_reviews.title: Good product but crazy price
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a Christmas present for my wife. Against my advice she bought a Macbook and then discovered that the tiny 13" screen was useless for photo-processing. So she wanted the 27" Thunderbolt Display. It is an excellent display but the price is crazy. For my photo-processing I use twin Dell 27" Ultrasharps which cost less (for the two) than this Apple screen. The good news is that the Amazon price saved £150 on the price in the local Apple Store. And my wife is happy.
customer_reviews.author: PhotoEcosse

customer_reviews.title: An impressive monitor; but read the small print on ...
customer_reviews.text: An impressive monitor; but read the small print on the box: in spite of anything they might tell you in the store, if you don't have thunderbolt on your computer, the display will not work. It makes no difference that the plug will fit the mini display port. It still won't work. This monitor is for computers with a thunderbolt port.
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: Turns my Mac laptop in to a desktop
customer_reviews.text: I work away from my desk a lot so I need a laptop as my primary machine, and the Thunderbolt display enables me to have a desktop setup in the office while retaining the freedom of a laptop. There are two wires coming from the display: power and Thunderbolt I/O, and by connecting those to my MacBook Pro I'm connected via the display to wired (gigabit) ethernet, a couple of external drives, a wired keyboard and, of course, a really nice 2560x1440 monitor with 2.1 speakers and a webcam.
customer_reviews.author: ML

customer_reviews.title: Lovely display and useful dock
customer_reviews.text: It's a beautiful display, provided you're not in an environment where there's too much light shining directly onto it. The 'dock' functions are enormously useful too - one cable (albeit two plugs) into the Mac Book Pro and it attaches everything, FireWire peripherals, USB, Ethernet, even other Thunderbolt peripherals. It could do with an update for USB3, though, and I would like to see an audio out on it. Hence 4* rather than 5*
customer_reviews.author: D. J. Stevenson

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for!
customer_reviews.text: Puts all other displays to shame. Yes you can get a similar spec display for half the price, but if you can afford it buy this instead. You may be poorer for it but you will not be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: sph

customer_reviews.title: Amazing screen
customer_reviews.text: I've been using a macbook pro for ages, and when I switched to this, it made a world of difference. My only concerns are that when my laptop goes into sleep mode, and I mover the mouse, the screen does not re-activate. I have to remove the cable, and then re-insert it. Also, when it comes out of sleep mode, I have to sometimes do the same thing with the keyboard cable.
customer_reviews.author: Stellar

customer_reviews.title: A DEFO MUST HAVE FOR EVERY APPLE FAN!
customer_reviews.text: Recently got once of these to plug into my Macbook pro 15 inch (early 2011) model! And my word, the resolution and colours are just breath taking! Awesome for playing games, video editing and sound editing etc! Decent 2.1 speakers but got some external 5.1s. Recently put 16gb of ram in my macbook also and BOOM! You can use the display to its full use! Well worth the money! PROS: Amazing resolution Colours and contrast breath taking Easy thunderbolt connecting CONS: Mic could do with been at the bottom of the monitor, I have to speak quite loudly on skype not no issue really No audio out/in on the display
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Apple Thunderbolt Display
customer_reviews.text: Worth every penny.... The display has rich sound and picture is stunning.... It has excellent functionality with the hub connections...
customer_reviews.author: Assured Creative Media

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic piece if kit...for current Macs
customer_reviews.text: As long as you have a recent Mac with Thunderbolt this is a fantastic display. Connected to my MacBook Pro it's an absolute joy. Provides power to my MacBook and with the Thunderbolt cable hooks up Ethernet, USB & Firewire plugged in to the back of the display. If you don't have a Thunderbolt port on your Mac or you don't have a Mac then I'd recommend looking elsewhere because this was designed to work with current Macs.
customer_reviews.author: B. Cooper
